channel.title: JCreator (LE - 4) cannot run my applets

item.title: JCreator (LE - 4) cannot run my applets
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:4, topic:46311”]public static void main(String[] args) { javax.swing.JFrame frame = new javax.swing.JFrame("..."); Football football = new Football(); football.init(); frame.add(football); frame.pack(); frame.setSize(100, 100); frame.setVisible(true); }[/quote]

Thank-you kind sir.

& Thanks Evil_ for the fast response.

Read full topic

item.title: JCreator (LE - 4) cannot run my applets

item.description:
@David wrote:

Yeah, I tried invoking a main() method, with repaint(); inside, but that yielded the same ‘error’.

Are you saying JCreator doesn’t run applets?

item.title: JCreator (LE - 4) cannot run my applets
item.dc:creator: @Evil1 Evil_
item.description:
@Evil1 wrote:

You don’t have a main() method, so you could run it in an applet with HTML.

[code]

alt="Your browser understands the <APPLET> tag but isn't running the applet, for some reason." Your browser is completely ignoring the <APPLET> tag!
[/code]

fill in

Read full topic

item.title: JCreator (LE - 4) cannot run my applets
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

First of all, here’s my code (That compiles FINE in TextPad):

[code]import java.applet.; // import the ‘applet’ package
import java.awt.; // import the ‘awt’ package (used for drawing)
import java.awt.event.*; // import the ‘awt.event’ package (used in this case for the mouse co-ords)

public class Football extends Applet implements MouseMotionListener // Tell it we’re making an Applet
{
int height, width; // Height and Width of the Applet
int mx, my; // X and Y locations of the mouse
int x3, y3; // Integers used in thickLineX and thickLineY
Color pitch = new Color(0, 153, 0);

public void init() // Set the Scene
{
	setBackground(Color.black); // Set the background colour to 'black'
	this.resize(500,300); // Resize the Applets dimensions
	width = getSize().width; // Assign the width of the Applet to 'int width'
	height = getSize().height; // Assign the height of the Applet to 'int height'
	addMouseMotionListener(this); // Used to get the mouse co-ords, for debugging purposes.
}

public void paint(Graphics g)
{
	g.setColor(pitch);
	g.fillRoundRect(5, 5, width - 10, height - 30, 50, 50);
	g.setColor(Color.white);
	thickLineX(g, 30, 20, 470, 20, 3);
	thickLineX(g, 30, 260, 470, 260, 3);
	thickLineY(g, 30, 20, 470, 20, 3);
}

public void thickLineX(Graphics g, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int thickness)
{
	x3 = x2 - x1;
	g.fillRect(x1, y1, x3, thickness);
}

public void thickLineY(Graphics g, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int thickness)
{
	y3 = y1 - y2;
	g.fillRect(x1, y1, thickness, y3);
}

public void mouseDragged(MouseEvent e) { }

public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e)
{
	mx = e.getX();
	my = e.getY();
    showStatus( "Mouse:(" + mx + "," + my + ")");
}

}
[/code]

So, I open that up in JCreator, and try and compile it’ which yields this:

--------------------Configuration: --------------------

Process completed.

Seems well and good - right? However, when trying to run the applet from Build > Execute Project or Build > Execute file, this comes up:

--------------------Configuration: -------------------- java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: main Exception in thread "main" Process completed.

Alright, I’m confused. Did I configure something wrong? Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
